body:
As a data point, I've missed that myself a few times before when organizing
the code base of mgo, one of them just a few weeks ago.

Also, for years we've had bson.M which is just a map[string]interface{},
for the mere convenience of not typing it all the time. An alias.

I suspect a lot of people organizing large code bases would do the same:
silently live within the existing constraints for having little hope of
seeing the situation improved.

Then, this is actually a mechanism of very simple semantics that aids in
preserving working code bases while improving them. In its absence people
are currently just moving, or creating a concrete type such as bson.M,
which makes the situation worse.

+1 on the proposal, assuming some nicer syntax (=> ?).
